page.title: 04BERKELEY
page.content: The small town of Berkeley lies about a mile and a half from the River Severn. About 1500 people live here. Some people work locally, at Berkeley Nuclear Power Station, for example, but others commute to Bristol, 20 miles away. The town is only 5 miles from an access point to the M5 motorway. Recently a by-pass was opened so that traffic to and from Sharpness Docks on the Severn does not have to go through the town. We have two tourist attractions in the town: Berkeley Castle and the Jenner Museum, as well as old houses in the town centre. We also have five antique shops. The bank is in a building which used to be a women's prison.
